value.title: Power BI and PowerShell

topItems.title: Get Started with Power BI PowerShell | Install PowerShell Cmdlets for Power BI
topItems.excerpt: In this session, we will talk about how we can get started with the Power BI PowerShell. For any organization, if we wish to perform some admin related tasks easily and in faster manner, PowerShell is the best option. So many operations we can perform very easily and faster.  This is the first introduction
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1TcIX1mXnb4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: How to Publish Power BI Report using PowerShell Cmdlet | Publish Power BI report using PowerShell
topItems.excerpt: During this video we will learn, how we can easily publish our Power BI report using PowerShell command. This is a very easy technique to publish our Power BI reports to our workspaces.  In this video, first we will publish our Power BI report to My Workspace using the PowerShell command. After that
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/0fs5v-TDkpk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Download Power BI Report File Using Windows PowerShell | PowerShell to Export Power BI Report File
topItems.excerpt: During this video we will learn, how we can easily download published Power BI report file(.pbix) file using PowerShell command.  In this video, first we will download/export the Power BI file from My Workspace. After that we will export the .Pbix file from specific Workspace.  I have uploaded PowerShell
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/L5P7LU1zX9Q" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Get List of All Workspaces as an Admin Using Windows PowerShell | PowerShell and Power BI
topItems.excerpt: In this video, we will learn how we can get the list of All the available Workspaces in Power BI tenant. Power BI provides PowerShell Administrator API. Using these APIs we can get the list of all workspaces based on the logged-in user. If you have access to Power BI Service Administrator, then we can
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Rfqs4jvxvuk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Embed Power BI
value.excerpt: The ability to embed Power BI into your site or application. This list has videos that are related to the different embedding options for Power BI. This includes Publish to web, the REST APIs and the Power BI Embedded Azure service.

topItems.title: What is Power BI Embedded?
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through what Power BI Embedded is. He talks about how you can get started with Power BI Embedded as well as what resources are available for you.  From the Azure portal to sample applications, along with documentation for APIs and usage of features, Adam
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/iEHfUuoZseo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: Create Power BI Embedded capacity in Microsoft Azure
topItems.excerpt: In this video, Adam, from Guy in a Cube, walks through how to create Power BI Embedded capacity in the Microsoft Azure portal. He also takes a look at some of the actions you can do within the Azure portal such as scaling and pause/start.  Follow us on Twitter - https://twitter.com/mspowerbi  More questions?
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/aXrvFfg_iSk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Create Power BI Embedded capacity in Microsoft Azure

topItems.title: 3 ways to embed Power BI
topItems.excerpt: In this video, we will look at three ways that you can embed Power BI into your website or application. This includes the Publish to Web feature, using the REST APIs and the new Power BI Embedded service within Microsoft Azure.  Watch the behind the scenes video over on Guy in a Cube - https://youtu.be/OqbVZfFhEzA
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/egP0GHSOUIM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

topItems.title: A look at the new Power BI embed sample
topItems.excerpt: This video takes a look at the new Power BI embed Sample that you can use to learn how to use the JavaScript API. With code examples and comments to give you a feel for what you need to do.   Report Embed Sample: https://microsoft.github.io/PowerBI-JavaScript/demo/code-demo/index.html  LET'S CONNECT!
topItems.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/nfkVljh_9O4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: A look at the new Power BI embed sample

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 1 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: As an administrator, how do you manage a Power BI tenant? How do you configure tenant settings, monitor usage, and provision licenses and other organizational resources? This learning path covers typical tasks and tools, such as the Power BI admin portal and Office 365 admin center. You will learn how to establish and provide governance for a Power BI environment and provision Power BI Premium capacity.

topItems.title: Understand the Power BI administrator role
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to administer Power BI to support business decisions backed by data.

topItems.title: Establish a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: This module covers topics relating to establishing a Power BI environment within Office 365 containers.

topItems.title: Provide governance in a Power BI environment
topItems.excerpt: Learn the fundamental rules, regulations, and policies of a BI governance approach.

topItems.title: Facilitate collaboration and sharing
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to collaborate and share dashboards and reports with coworkers.

value.title: Administer Power BI, Part 2 - Tenants, governance, collaboration
value.excerpt: Power BI administrators manage every aspect of their tenant. This learning path covers advanced administrative tasks, such as fostering collaboration and sharing data. You will earn how to monitor and audit usage, build a data access infrastructure, broaden the reach of Power BI, and automate administration with APIs and PowerShell cmdlets.

topItems.title: Provision Premium capacity in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn about the differences between Power BI Pro and Power BI Premium, and how Power BI Premium manages capacity resources.

topItems.title: Establish a data access infrastructure in Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to establish a data access infrastructure for accessing all your data within Power BI.

topItems.title: Broaden the reach of Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Learn the various ways to share Power BI reports beyond your Power BI tenant.

topItems.title: Automate Power BI administration
topItems.excerpt: Common manual tasks can be automated with Microsoft Power BI Cmdlets for Windows PowerShell and PowerShell core.

value.title: Consume data with Power BI
value.excerpt: Do you want to make business decisions backed by data? Learn how to do that in Power BI. Learn to work in Power BI to review and interact with this content to make business decisions.

topItems.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
topItems.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

topItems.title: Analyze data with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: This module goes beyond viewing and exploring your content and explains how to interact with it by working with reports and dashboards to uncover and share new business insights.

value.title: Gain insights into your data through intelligent tools in Power BI
value.excerpt: Gain insights into your data through intelligent tools in Power BI

topItems.title: Deliver decision-making insights with Power BI
topItems.excerpt: Deliver decision-making insights with Power BI

topItems.title: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure
topItems.excerpt: Build systems of insights for enterprise scale with Power BI and Azure

topItems.title: Advance Power BI Premium for the enterprise analytics market and beyond
topItems.excerpt: Advance Power BI Premium for the enterprise analytics market and beyond

topItems.title: Gain insights into usage and performance of your Power BI reports to increase adoption and reduce costs
topItems.excerpt: Gain insights into usage and performance of your Power BI reports to increase adoption and reduce costs

value.title: Power BI for Tableau users
value.excerpt: Are you a Tableau user who needs to learn Microsoft Power BI? This learning path enables you to leverage your existing Tableau skills to create power data-driven reports and dashboards in Power BI. You will learn to use the Microsoft Power BI desktop application and the Power BI service to connect to data, model and visualize data, and then share you findings. Finally, we provide guidance on how to produce and maintain optimized Power BI solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Power BI for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: The purpose of this module is to help Tableau analysts switch from Tableau to Microsoft Power BI.

topItems.title: Connect data to Power BI for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides the foundational information needed to connect to your data confidently with the new platform.

topItems.title: Create Power BI calculations for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides guidance on Power BI calculation concepts, and how to create and edit calculations.

topItems.title: Organize and simplify Power BI fields for Tableau users
topItems.excerpt: This module provides guidance on how to organize and simplify your calculations.

value.title: Explore what Power BI can do for you
value.excerpt: As a consumer, you'll work in the Power BI service to review and interact with content that has been shared with you. This module provides the foundational information that you need to work effectively in the Power BI service.

value.title: Year over Year and Month over Month Calculations in Power BI
value.excerpt: Learn how to quickly produce time intelligence calcution in Power BI using these easy to follow DAX equations. Elevate your time series analysis.

For more information about SelectedValue, check out Marco Russo's blog on the function - https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/using-the-selectedvalue-function-in-dax/  LET'S CONNECT!

value.title: What is Power BI Gateway? Do You Need it to Connect to On-Premise Data? Can You Avoid Using One?
value.excerpt: Power BI Gateway acts as a bridge to let PowerBI.com (Cloud) connect to your On-Premise (Local) Data Sources  like local Excel Files or a local SQL Server.   Watch our complete video series on Power BI Gateways: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7GQQXV5Z8edw57_eLqD9By5mzxIqxSJ1 1. What is a Power

value.title: Append vs Merge in Power BI and Power Query
value.excerpt: Combining two queries in Power Query or in Power BI is one of the most basic and also essential tasks that you would need to do in most of data preparation scenarios. There are two types of combining queries; Merge, and Append. Database developers easily understand the difference, but the majority of

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Specifying multiple filter conditions in CALCULATE
value.excerpt: The filter arguments in CALCULATE can reference multiple columns from the same table in a single predicate: This is possible since March 2021 in Power BI, before that it was possible to filter a single column reference.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/705207?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
